title: Fidelity files S-1 application with US SEC for spot ETH EFT with staking
description:
Staking rewards could create a taxable event for shareholders and introduce new risks associated with the fund.

Fidelity filed an S-1 application with the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on March 27 to create a spot Ether (ETH) exchange-traded fund (ETF). As expected from an earlier filing, the ETF will give Fidelity the option to stake part of the ETH it holds. 

The asset management giant’s ETF would trade on the Cboe BZX Exchange. Fidelity Digital Asset Services, which affiliated with sponsor FD Funds Management, would serve as custodian of the trust’s ETH. According to the S-1:

That decision entails additional risk, the application noted. There would be a risk of loss “including in the form of ‘slashing’ penalties” and liquidity risks while the stake is being processed. In addition, staking rewards would be treated as income for the fund for tax purposes, as a result of which investors will experience a taxable event “without an associated distribution from the Trust.”

Read more

title: Bitcoin currently in ‘middle of the bull run’ — Grayscale report
description:
Grayscale says multiple metrics make it clear that Bitcoin is in the “middle of the bull run.”

Historical Bitcoin (BTC) market cycle indicators show that the crypto market is “presently in the middle of the bull run,” backed by a mix of strong fundamental and technical factors, according to a recent report from Grayscale. 

It is not easy to determine the onset of crypto bull runs apart from the fact that BTC price has often peaked 8-11 months after Bitcoin supply halving. Grayscale analysts set out in a recent report to outline the key elements of a bull market.

These factors were broken down into the precursors and the “fifth inning,” showing where the market currently stands.

Read more

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

A U.S. District judge has struck down Coinbase's motion to dismiss a lawsuit brought forward against it by the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Meanwhile, rumors surfaced of a potential token merger of three AI protocols, and NFT game Munchables was hacked for $63 million in ETH. 

Coinbase’s attempt to dismiss a lawsuit by the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) was struck down in court on March 27.

U.S. District Judge Katherine Failla ruled that the SEC may continue to pursue legal action against Coinbase over allegations that the company operated as an unregistered exchange, broker and clearing agency.

Read more
